org.ardenus.input

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ardenus.input.Input

  • public final class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for handling input easily with the use of InputHandlers.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

    • Method Detail

      • hasTypeDuplicates

        private static final boolean hasTypeDuplicates(InputHandler... handlers)
        Checks if the specified array of handlers has any duplicate class types.
        Parameters:
        handlers - the array of handlers to check.
        Returns:
        true if the array has any class duplicates, false otherwise.

      • addListener

        public static void addListener(InputListener listener)
        Adds the specified listener to the input manager.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.

      • removeListener

        public static void removeListener(InputListener listener)
        Removes the specified listener from the input manager.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove.

      • callEvent

        public static void callEvent(java.util.function.Consumer<? super InputListener> event)
        Calls the specified event.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be called.

      • addButtonSet

        public static void addButtonSet(ButtonSet buttonSet)
        Adds a button set to the list of button sets and registers it as an input listener. This method should only be called by the ButtonSet class during initialization.
        Parameters:
        buttonSet - the button set to add.

      • removeButtonSet

        public static void removeButtonSet(ButtonSet buttonSet)
        Removes a button set from the list of button sets and unregisters it from the input listeners. This method should only be called by the ButtonSet class during finalization.
        Parameters:
        buttonSet - the button set to remove.

      • addButton

        public static void addButton(Button button)
        Adds a button to the list of buttons. This method should only be called by the Button class during initialization.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to add.

      • removeButton

        public static void removeButton(Button button)
        Removes a button set from the list of buttons. This method should only be called by the Button class during finalization.
        Parameters:
        button - the button to remove.

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()
        Returns:
        true if the input manager is initialized, false otherwise.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(int maxControllers,
                              Window window,
                              InputHandler... handlers)
        Initializes the input manager.
        Parameters:
        maxControllers - the maximum amount of controllers that can be connected at once.
        window - the window the input manager will get input data from.
        handlers - the input handlers.

                              InputHandler... handlers)

        handlers - the input handlers.

        handlers - the input handler classes.

      • shouldOverrideKeyboards

        public static boolean shouldOverrideKeyboards()
        Returns:
        true if the keyboard will be ignored when calling getEmptyPlayerSlot(), false otherwise.

        Parameters:

      • pressButton

                               boolean pressed,
                               boolean forceNotification)
        Sets the press state of the specified button.
        Parameters:
        button - the button of the button press state to change.
        pressed - true if the button should be pressed, falseotherwise.
        forceNotification - true if notification should be forcibly sent, false otherwise.

                               boolean pressed)

      • getMaxControllers

        public static int getMaxControllers()
        Returns:
        the maximum amount of controllers that can be connected at one time.

      • getEmptyPlayerSlot

        public static int getEmptyPlayerSlot()
        Returns:
        the next empty player slot, -1 if there are none.

      • hasEmptyPlayerSlot

        public static boolean hasEmptyPlayerSlot()
        Returns:
        true if there are any available player slots left that can be used, false otherwise.

      • getControllers

        public static Controller[] getControllers(InputHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to get the controllers from.
        Returns:
        the connected controllers that belong to the handler.

        public static Controller[] getControllers()

      • hasController

        public static boolean hasController(Controller controller)
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the controller is connected, false otherwise.

      • hasController

        public static boolean hasController(int player)
        Parameters:
        player - the player slot to check.
        Returns:
        true if there is a controller connected to the player slot, false otherwise.

      • hasControllerClass

        public static boolean hasControllerClass(int player,
                                         java.lang.Class<? extends Controller> controllerClazz)
        Parameters:
        player - the player slot to check.
        controllerClazz - the controller class type to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the controller connected to the player slot is of or extended from the controller class type, false otherwise.

      • getController

        public static Controller getController(int player)
        Parameters:
        player - the player slot to get.
        Returns:
        the controller connected to the specified player slot.

      • isHandlerController

        public static boolean isHandlerController(int player,
                                          InputHandler handler)
        Parameters:
        player - the player number of the controller to check.
        handler - the handler type of the controller.
        Returns:
        true if the controller in the player slot belongs to the handler, false otherwise.
